Title: Experienced Data Mining and Business Intelligence Engineer
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
At Boeing, our Industrial Engineers are leaders in innovation, development, evaluation, and implementation of methods and systems in support of complex manufacturing processes. Our Industrial Engineers have the unique opportunity to support the fabrication and assembly for the next generation Air Force Trainer, bombers and tactical fighter aircraft, autonomous air vehicles, rotorcraft, advanced airborne sensors, space vehicles, satellites, weapons systems, the commercial fleet of single and twin aisle airplanes and much more.
In joining us you will work in a casual but professional environment with multi-disciplined teams of engineers that take pride in developing, integrating, testing and delivering innovative solutions. We offer long-term potential for career growth into both technical leadership and/or management positions and highly value the curiosity, tenacity and imagination our engineers bring to our teams each day.
Join us and you will have the unique opportunity to design, stabilize, improve, and transform production systems and processes to achieve world class operational excellence for some of the world’s most sophisticated aircraft and systems. Come build your career with Boeing!
The Boeing Space Launch System (SLS) team is seeking an Experienced Data Mining and Business Intelligence Engineer to join the team at the NASA Michoud Assembly Facility (MAF) in New Orleans, LA. This position includes responsibility for the design of complex Business Intelligence information dashboards, metrics, and predictive/prescriptive analytic solutions/models to meet business objectives.
The successful candidate will be responsible for evaluating business objectives and determining stakeholder needs and support the execution of large-scale projects that aligns with program long range business planning. Combines programming, SQL skills, predictive modeling, business understanding and industrial engineering expertise to deliver efficient and scalable Business Intelligence solutions to improve business productivity and business outcome. Business Intelligence solution are expected to include combing, cleaning, and preparing data for modeling, choosing and defining best fit models/algorithms, validating and deploying, and then improving these solutions.
Boeing and NASA are building the world’s largest rocket for human exploration of deep space. The Space Launch System (SLS) provides a critical heavy-lift capability, powering people and cargo beyond our moon and into deep space to enable diverse exploration, science and security missions.
Primary Responsibilities:
Combine, Clean/prepare datasets for modelingCommunicates findings from data using visualizationsBuilds automated visualizations and solutions to offer “data-driven” decision makingApplies automation to existing manual processesUse Industrial Engineering and business understanding in order to assess business needs and define projectsDevelops and fosters relationships with various functions and stakeholders
This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options. 
This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R.

120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

This position requires the ability to obtain a clearance for access to a National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) facility.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills & Experience):

Bachelor's, Master's or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry3+ years of experience in an engineering or technical field1+ year of experience with SQL1+ years of experience with data modelingAdvanced Knowledge of BI & analytic tools such as Tableau, Power BI and the platforms that support them.1+ year of experience working with databases1+ years of experience with running statistical analysis of large datasets, drawing conclusions from analyses, and presenting the information.Experience in problem solving and improvement projects3+ years of experience with Microsoft Office applications

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):

Experience with Agile FrameworksExperience working in software development environmentExperience with Regression, non-linear, and cluster modeling,Experience with statistical modeling and/or machine learningExperience with database management and languages for it (SQL, R, Python, JMP, Tableau, etc)Ability to travel 10%

Typical Education & Experience: 

Bachelor's degree and typically 5 or more years' experience in an engineering classification or a Master's degree with typically 3 or more years' experience in an engineering classification or a PhD degree with experience in an engineering classification. In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

Relocation: 

This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Drug Free Workplace:

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:

This position is for 1st shift.

Safety Sensitive:

This is a NASA safety-sensitive position and is subject to random drug and alcohol testing.

Eligible for 3ERP

Equal Opportunity Employer:

Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Science and Analytics Manager
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Commercial Airplanes (BCA) is looking for a Data Science and Analytics Manager (Level K) to join the Supply Chain Operations, Functional Excellence team based out of Everett, Washington. 
The successful candidate will help to drive transformation of the organization by providing real time insights for complex business problems to improve and aide supply chain team's decision-making process. You will contribute as a leader alongside Business Intelligence (BI) Analysts, Data Scientists, System & Process specialists and work closely with the business to deliver solutions that enable Boeing Company to deliver safer, better and more efficient airplanes and product.
Position Responsibilities: 
Manage employees performing data science and analytics.Develops and completes project and process plans, implements policies and procedures and sets operational goals.Acquires resources for projects and processes, provides technical management of suppliers and leads process improvements.Develops and maintains relationships and partnerships with customers, collaborators, peers, partners and direct reports.Provides vision, oversight, and approval of technical approaches, products and processes.Manages, develops and motivates employees.
This position is expected to be 80% onsite, and 20% telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite in Everett, Washington.
Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
3+ years of experience in an informal or formal leadership position3+ years of experience in business analytics3+ years of experience working with databases
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Bachelor’s Degree (or foreign equivalent) or higher in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or a related field3+ years of experience in Supply Chain Management3+ years of experience coaching, mentoring, guiding and leading teams3+ years of experience in a role that required outstanding written and verbal communication skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and team skills1+ years of experience in Project or Program Management1+ years of experience with Agile software development practices, preferably trained in SAFe1+ years of experience in a role that requires knowledge of the extract, transform and load (ETL) process
Relocation:
Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
Shift Work Statement: 
This position is first shift
Union:
This is a non-unionized position
Total Rewards 
At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.
The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

Summary pay range: $152,150-$205,850

Title: Experienced Enterprise Safety Data Analyst
JD:
About the job
    


Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Come join an exciting data analytics team in performing complex data analysis of aviation data as an Experienced Enterprise Safety Data Analyst in Everett, WA. As modern aircraft produce increasing amounts of data in operations and maintenance, analytics is required to transform that data into actionable insight for Boeing’s engineering and business teams.
The Enterprise Safety Data Analytics team is looking to hire a highly skilled engineering data analyst with knowledge in fields such as advanced statistics, data engineering, and experience with developing customer oriented reports and visualizations.
These skills will be used to coordinate with other Boeing engineering teams, Airline stakeholders, and other analytics teams in the effort to develop data-driven solutions for the measurement, characterization and analysis of airline operational safety.
As a member of the Enterprise Safety Data Analytics team, the candidate will collaborate with other data scientists and data engineers to analyze data, perform data/feature engineering work, engage with customers, and assist in the growth of a key focus area for Boeing engineering in Safety Analytics. This data analytics is partnered with other analytics organizations across the Enterprise to focus on identifying and solving critical safety needs utilizing in-service data and insights.
The ideal candidate for this role would have:
A passion for continuous learning, teaching and collaboratingExperience integrating both internal and external data in order to provide robust recommendationsThe ability to define, build and deploy artificial intelligence and machine learning solutionsExcellent communication skills that will enable them to work directly with stakeholders and business leaders to scope problems, explain results clearly and address any concerns in terms that can be understood by a non-technical community of stakeholders.
Position Responsibilities
Researches, analyzes, and compiles technical data for company products and system-level concepts in the projected operational environments to optimize effectiveness over the program lifecycle Applies systems engineering processes, methodologies and tools to the design of system of systems, systems and new product developmentDerives and develops architectures, functional requirements, refinements and product designsPerforms technical planning and control; maintains and improves processes and software toolsTrains and instructs others Works under general direction
This position allows telecommuting. The selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options.
This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a “US Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R.

120.15 is required. “US Person” includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):

5+ years of experience in database management, programming, statistical modeling and/or machine learning (SQL, R, Python, JMP, Tableau, etc.)Experience working in the field of Artificial Intelligence including Machine LearningProgramming experience in one or more of the following: Java, R, Python, SQL

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):

Experience with Data Analytics that provide deeper learning opportunitiesExperience developing and deploying applications that utilize Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning techniquesFamiliarity with the safety data ecosystem related to product safetyStrong airplane technical knowledge, Engineering Liaison background a plusSome familiarity and background with the art of what is possible using IT tools and visualization techniquesExperience participating on or leading Agile/Scrum teams2+ years work experience or relevant coursework training machine learning models in a cloud computing environment such as: AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, etcExperience working with analytics technology stacks; Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Teradata, etcGood organizational, interpersonal, and problem solving skillsAbility to adjust priorities to multiple demands and unanticipated eventsHighly motivated and must work well in a team environmentThe ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writingAbility to work effectively with diverse engineering teams across the enterpriseIntrinsic aptitude for taking initiative, leading cross functional teams and complex projectsAbility and willingness to take ownership of work activities to ensure they are completed accurately, efficiently, and in a timely manner

Typical Education & Experience: 

Technical bachelor’s degree and typically 5 or more years’ related work experience or a Master’s degree with typically 3 or more years’ or a PhD degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience. A technical degree is defined as any four-year degree, or greater, in a mathematic, scientific or information technology field of study.

Relocation: 

Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit for this position. Candidates must live in the immediate area or relocate at their own expense.

Drug Free Workplace:

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift Work Statement: 

This position is for 1st shift

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
